text: The Visegrád Congress of 1335 was a meetingof the rulers of Poland, Hungrary, and Bohemia met. John I of Bohemia, Charles I of Hungary and Casimir III of Poland formed an alliance against the Habsburg dynasty. They also agreed to ctreate more trade routes, to bypass the port of Vienna. The congress also said that the Duchy of Silesia was Czech. In 1339, there was another meeting, which chose the Czech king. Visegrád is a city in Hungary, about north of Budapest. Category:1335
title: Congress of Visegrád (1335)
